org.apache.flink.api.java.record.io

Class ExternalProcessInputFormat<T extends ExternalProcessInputSplit>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flink.api.common.io.GenericInputFormat<Record>
      • org.apache.flink.api.java.record.io.GenericInputFormat
        • org.apache.flink.api.java.record.io.ExternalProcessInputFormat<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the input split (must extend ExternalProcessInputSplit)
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, InputFormat<Record,GenericInputSplit>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExternalProcessFixedLengthInputFormat

    public abstract class ExternalProcessInputFormat<T extends ExternalProcessInputSplit>
extends GenericInputFormat
    This input format starts an external process and reads its input from the standard out (stdout) of the started process. The process is started outside of the JVM via a provided start command and can be an arbitrary program, e.g., a data generator or a shell script. The input format checks the exit code of the process to validate whether the process terminated correctly. A list of allowed exit codes can be provided. The input format requires (ExternalProcessInputSplit objects that hold the command to execute. Attention!
    You must take care to read from (and process) both output streams of the process, standard out (stdout) and standard error (stderr). Otherwise, the input format might get deadlocked!
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • configure

        public void configure(Configuration parameters)
        Description copied from interface: InputFormat
        Configures this input format. Since input formats are instantiated generically and hence parameterless, this method is the place where the input formats set their basic fields based on configuration values.

        This method is always called first on a newly instantiated input format.

        Specified by:
        configure in interface InputFormat<Record,GenericInputSplit>
        Overrides:
        configure in class GenericInputFormat<Record>
        Parameters:
        parameters - The configuration with all parameters.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: InputFormat
        Method that marks the end of the life-cycle of an input split. Should be used to close channels and streams and release resources. After this method returns without an error, the input is assumed to be correctly read.

        When this method is called, the input format it guaranteed to be opened.

        Specified by:
        close in interface InputFormat<Record,GenericInputSplit>
        Overrides:
        close in class GenericInputFormat<Record>
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown, if the input could not be closed properly.

      • open

        public void open(GenericInputSplit split)
          throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: InputFormat
        Opens a parallel instance of the input format to work on a split.

        When this method is called, the input format it guaranteed to be configured.

        Specified by:
        open in interface InputFormat<Record,GenericInputSplit>
        Overrides:
        open in class GenericInputFormat<Record>
        Parameters:
        split - The split to be opened.
        Throws:
